trigger_threshold.description: The input value that causes the weapon to fire. Range is 0-9 for the inputs, but only 3-8 are valid for trigger resistance.

trigger_threshold_release.description: The input value that causes the weapon to stop firing (Should be equal or less than the regular threshold).

resistance_strength_start.description: The amount of resistance in the beginning.

resistance_strength_end.description: The amount of resistance at the end. 0 means no trigger effect!

vibration_amplitude.description: The vibration strength once the trigger is past the threshold. 0 means off.

vibration_frequency.description: The vibration frequency once the trigger is past the threshold.

vibration_frequency_variance.description: The vibration frequency variance once the trigger is past the threshold.

charge_up_vibration_frequency_start.description: (Used by weapons that have spin up, charge, beam, etc) Replace the initial trigger resist with a vibration. This determines the vibration at 0% charge. 0 means off.

charge_up_vibration_frequency_end.description: (Used by weapons that have spin up, charge, beam, etc) Replace the initial trigger resist with a vibration strength. This determines the vibration at 100% charge.

weight_resistance.description: The amount of maximum resistance when aiming a weapon.

double_action_trigger.description: If above 0, will activate the single shot trigger. Number determines by how much to offset the regular trigger.

double_action_regular_offset.description: If double action is enabled, but we aren't in Full Auto, how much should the trigger threshold be offsetted by.

on_fire_event.description: [string]The name of the audio event to send to the trigger on every fire event (for rumble + controller audio).
